data.name: Write your own Promise implementation
data.description:
Write your own [`Promise`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise) implementation (call it `Vow`), including the following:

```javascript
/**
  A Vow is your own implementation of a Promise
*/
class Vow {
  /**
    The Vow() constructor creates Vow objects.
  */
  constructor (executor) {}
  
  /**
    The then() method of Vow instances takes up to two arguments: callback functions for the fulfilled and rejected cases of the Vow. It immediately returns an equivalent Vow object, allowing you to chain calls to other vow methods.
  */
  then (onFulfilled, onRejected) {}
  
  /**
    The catch() method of Vow instances schedules a function to be called when the vow is rejected. It immediately returns an equivalent Vow object, allowing you to chain calls to other vow methods. It is a shortcut for Vow.prototype.then(undefined, onRejected).
  */
  catch (onRejected) {}
}
```

For example, all of these Vows resolve to `1`:
```javascript
new Vow(resolve => resolve(1))
new Vow(resolve => resolve(new Vow(resolve => resolve(1))))

new Vow(resolve => resolve(1)).then(value => value)
new Vow(resolve => resolve(1)).then(value => new Vow(resolve => resolve(value)))

new Vow((resolve, reject) => reject()).then(undefined, () => 1)
new Vow((resolve, reject) => reject()).catch(() => 1)
new Vow((resolve, reject) => reject()).then().then().then().catch(() => 1)
```

And all of these Vows reject with `Error('uh oh')`:
```javascript
new Vow((resolve, reject) => reject(Error('uh oh')))
new Vow(() => { throw Error('uh oh') })
new Vow(resolve => resolve(new Vow(reject => reject(Error('uh oh')))))

new Vow(resolve => resolve()).then(() => new Vow((resolve, reject) => reject(Error('uh oh'))))
new Vow(resolve => resolve()).then(() => { throw Error('uh oh') })
```

`Promise` and `require` won't work!
